name: Chicken Cardamom Curry
description: A quick to prepare and simple curry with freshly ground cardamom being the dominant flavour. The key to success with this recipe is taking care to not burn the spices.

steps.text: Heat the oil on medium-low heat in a large pot.
In an electric spice grinder, grind the cardamom pods and black pepper into a powder. It is crucial to use fresh, unground pods and peppercorns to get the proper taste in this recipe!
Chop the chicken into chunks suitably sized for currying, about 3x3cm.
Add the cardamom and black pepper to the hot oil. It should be very lightly bubbling, but not sizzling violently. Continually stir the oil and spices for 5 minutes. Do NOT let it burn!
Add the chicken and toss it in the spicy paste. Add the coriander, chili, salt and turmeric, stirring constantly. Do this for another 5 minutes.
Add the can of diced tomatoes and yogurt. Reduce heat slightly. Make sure the chicken is completely submerged in liquid. Top off with water if needed, to cover the chicken.
Cover and cook until chicken reaches a safe internal temperature (~74C). Serve over rice with naan and optionally garnish with a bit of chopped cilantro.
